intro: Oxytropis yanchiensis, commonly known as the Yanchi milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow to reddish-purple flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. Due to its ecological significance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
